title: Mansion Global Daily: Overvalued Munich, New-Build U.K. Hot Spots and More
text:
Munich Ranks as most Overvalued Global Market, at Risk of Bubble

No U.S. real estate markets are considered unsustainably high, according to UBS report. Read More

BY THE NUMBERS

TRENDING TODAY

LISTING OF THE DAY

A Fully Furnished Model Apartment in the Tallest Building in London’s Tech City

The 31st-floor flat boasts impressive views and two balconies. Read More

THE INSIDERS

Sotheby’s International Realty’s Executive Says Customizing a Home is Key

Julie Leonhardt LaTorre says high-end home buyers want homes they can make a mark on. Read More

NEWS BITES

Brisbane, Australia, Homes Selling for Profit Starts to Rise Brisbane’s property market remains safe as 93.4% of homes sold for a profit last quarter, according to CoreLogic’s Pain & Gain report. Apartment sales are struggling, however, with properties reselling for a loss of 13%. Sydney apartments sold for a loss of 11% and Melbourne at a loss of 7.7%. Realestate.com.au

Lived-In Home Prices in Hong Kong Drop by 1.4% in August For the third straight month, Hong Kong’s lived-in home prices fell in August due to the increasing pressure from the U.S.-China trade war and social unrest, according to the Rating and Valuation Department. Analysts expect the rate will continue to fall as the pro-democracy rallies continue throughout the city. South China Morning Post

Reportage Properties Offers 10% Off Residential Units in Dubai and Abu Dhabi U.A.E.-based real estate developer Reportage Properties announced a 10% discount on all residential property units in Dubai and Abu Dhabi Properties in projects that are under construction. The offer stands until the end of day Monday. The developer is expected to deliver thousands of new properties to the market by 2021. Khaleej Times

U.S. New Single-Family Home Starts Drop to Historic Levels Single-family home construction is expected to remain under historic averages until 2022, which will continue to drive demand up for the limited inventory of pre-existing single-family homes, according to Zillow. PropertyWire

New-Build U.K. Hot Spots Emerge in England and Wales New-build properties have accounted for 11% of total sales this year across England and Wales. In London, newly built homes account for 13% of transactions, according to Stone Real Estate. The Help-to-Buy program is attributed as having helped fuel demand for new build properties in the U.K., said Michael Stone, chief executive of Stone Real Estate. PropertyWire

AROUND NEWS CORP

A Trump Bump Is Turning Up the Heat on Greenland’s Real-Estate Market [The Wall Street Journal]

Decline of the Cash Buyer [The Times of London]

‘Mad Men’-Inspired Brooklyn Apartment Asks Less Than $1M [New York Post]

Donald Rumsfeld Selling Maryland Home Known as 'Mount Misery' for $2.45M [realtor.com]
description: Mansion Global’s daily round-up of the latest luxury real estate news from around the world
